jcr:content.jcr:title: Transport in the Republic of the Congo

contentheadline.headline: Transport in the Republic of the Congo

contentrichtext.text: {{lead missing|date=February 2013}} == Railways == [[File:Railways_in_Congo.svg|thumb|Railway network of Republic of Congo]] <br>''total:'' 795 km (includes 285 km private track) - [[Congo-Ocean Railway]] connects [[Brazzaville]] and [[Pointe-Noire]]. <br>''narrow gauge:'' 795 km 1.067-m gauge (1995 est.) === Railway links to adjacent countries === * [[Transport in the Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of the Congo (Cabinda)]] - no - same gauge {{RailGauge|1067mm}} * [[Transport in Gabon|Gabon]] - no - [[break of gauge]] {{RailGauge|1067mm}}/{{RailGauge|1435mm}} * [[Transport in Cameroon|Cameroon]] - no - [[break of gauge]] {{RailGauge|1067mm}}/{{RailGauge|1000mm}} * [[Transport in the Central African Republic|Central African Republic]] - no - no railways === Maps === * [http://www.un.org/Depts/Cartographic/map/profile/congo.pdf UN Map] * [http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/RWB.NSF/db900LargeMaps/SKAR-64GDLY?OpenDocument&cc=cog&rc=1] * [http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/fullMaps_Af.nsf/luFullMap/BC0EF176D6BCADE385256C0800474100/$File/wfp_safr_rails0702.pdf?OpenElement UNJLC Rail map of Southern Africa] === Cities served by rail === {{Main|Railway stations in Congo}} == Timeline == === 2007 === * 12 April 2007 According to [[Engineering News]], a South Korean consortium has agreed to build a new 800 km railway in the Congo-Brazzaville Republic in return for timber concessions. They would build a railway from [[Brazzaville]] to [[Ouesso]] in the Sangha region in the north-west of the country. A two-year feasibility study would take place before signing a final agreement with the government and starting construction work on the railway. <ref> http://news.mongabay.com/2007/0425-congo.html </ref> See [[CMKC Group]]. === 2006 === * [http://www.reliefweb.int/rw/RWB.NSF/db900SID/RURI-6P7PSC?OpenDocument Rail service suspended by floods and oil shortages] === 2003 === * [http://www.cpcstrans.com/Investment/InvestCongo.htm Concessioning] == Highways == <br>''total:'' 12,800 km <br>''paved:'' 1,242 km <br>''unpaved:'' 11,558 km (1996 est.) == Waterways == the Congo and Ubangi (Oubangui) rivers provide 1,120 km of commercially navigable water transport; other rivers are used for local traffic only == Pipelines == crude oil 25 km == Ports and harbours == === Atlantic Ocean === * [[Pointe-Noire]] === Congo River === * [[Brazzaville]] * [[Impfondo]] === Other Rivers === * [[Oyo (Congo)|Oyo]] === Sangha River === * [[Ouesso]] == Airports == 36 (1999 est.) === Airports - with paved runways === <br>''total:'' 4 <br>''over 3,047 m:'' 1 <br>''1,524 to 2,437 m:'' 3 (1999 est.) === Airports - with unpaved runways === <br>''total:'' 32 <br>''1,524 to 2,437 m:'' 8 <br>''914 to 1,523 m:'' 14 <br>''under 914 m:'' 10 (1999 est.) == See also == {{CIA World Factbook}} * [[Republic of the Congo]] == References == {{Reflist}} {{Economy of the Republic of the Congo}} {{Africa in topic|Transport in}} [[Category:Transport in the Republic of the Congo| ]]
